result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Jesus E Galvan-Peralta in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter, Daniel Lopez, appeared on behalf of the defendant.
  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Plea questionnaire filed.  
State's offer and recommendation:   Plea to count 1, hit/run; counts 2 and 3 will be dismissed.  Counts 2 and 3  may be reissued as municipal citation.  State cannot meet burden on counts 2,3.  Recommend 9 mos RCJ on hit/run charge.
15CF1734:  Plea to count 2; d/ri count 1.  Follow recommendation of PSI
Court colloquy re rights being waived, elements of charges and possible penalties.
PLEA - guilty each of 2 counts
Court finds plea entered freely, knowingly, intellingently and voluntarily
Finding of guilt
PSI ordered
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jesus E Galvan-Peralta in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Interpreter Services provided by Alberto Aguilar.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Matter was set as FPT for JT on 5/11.  Parties have reached an agreement and req PLEAH.
ZCI

Ct 1: 346.67(1)-Hit and Run-Involve Injury; Ct 2: 346.63(1)(a)1-Cause Injury/OWI; Ct 3: 346.63(1)(b)2-Cause injury/OWI. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.   No contact with the victim, SH (person, property, residence or family).   DO NOT DRIVE UNLESS PROPERLY LICENSED AND INSURED. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jesus E Galvan-Peralta in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Katie Giebel.
The State requests bond be increased to $500.00.

BTC: Modify bond to $500.00 cash. All terms and conditions as previously ordered remain. DO NOT DRIVE W/O VALID LICENSE AND VALID INSURANCE
